value.title: Waymo Expands Self-Driving Car Trials to San Francisco
value.excerpt: Way-mo, way-mo, off to work they go. Waymo employees in San Francisco will be able to catch a ride to work from its fleet of self-driving, all-electric Jaguar I-PACE cars.

value.title: Artificial intelligence really isn’t all that intelligent
value.excerpt: Narrow AI applications such as Google Search and Amazon Alexa are great at solving specific problems, but only as long as you stick to the script.

value.title: Artificial intelligence beats eight world champions at bridge
value.excerpt: Victory marks milestone for AI as bridge requires more human skills than other strategy games

value.title: Tesla’s head of AI is on sabbatical and people are worried
value.excerpt: Elon Musk announced that Tesla’s head of AI, Andrej Karpathy, is on a four-month sabbatical, and people are worried since other Tesla execs have left after going on sabbatical. It comes as Tesla expands its Full Self-Driving (FSD) Beta to Canada.

value.title: Toyota starts testing self-driving ride-hailing fleet
value.excerpt: Toyota, together with Aurora Innovation Inc., is currently testing a fleet of self-driving Sienna units in Texas.

value.title: Self-Driving Startup Zongmu Raises $157 Million in New Funds
value.excerpt: Zongmu Technology Shanghai Co. has raised more than 1 billion yuan ($157 million) in a new round as the Chinese autonomous driving system startup looks to build a new production plant.

value.title: Researchers Warn: Risks of Using AI To Grow Our Food Are Substantial and Must Not Be Ignored
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) is on the cusp of driving an agricultural revolution, and helping confront the challenge of feeding our growing global population in a sustainable way. But researchers warn that using new AI technologies at scale holds huge risks that are not being considered.
